text: Escape to tranquility with this off-grid, unfinished cabin nestled on a spacious 1.64-acre lot on a dead-end road. This unique AS-IS property offers breathtaking panoramic views, perfect for those seeking a peaceful retreat or a blank canvas to create their dream home. Your wait to discover your dream home in this beautifully updated 1880 sq ft manufactured home, nestled on 2.8 acres with breathtaking views of the entire Salt Lake City Valley and the majestic Wasatch Mountains is over. This serene mountain retreat offers the perfect blend of modern amenities and rustic charm, ensuring a comfortable and picturesque lifestyle. Recent updates include: A brand new roof, completely remodeled guest bathroom, luxurious free-standing soaker tub in the primary bathroom, new carpet and flooring in both bathrooms, and fresh paint throughout the home. The spacious layout includes an oversized 2-car garage, connected via a breezeway featuring a cozy wood-burning stove. This versatile space is perfect for an art studio, workshop, or additional living area. Experience daily visits from deer and other wildlife right in your yard, creating a peaceful, nature-filled environment. Despite its secluded location, this home is just a quick drive to the District Shopping Area, offering convenience without sacrificing tranquility. Embrace the best of both worlds-mountain living with modern comforts-at this stunning property on Shaggy Mountain Road. Schedule your private tour today and make this extraordinary home your own!
Open house 5/17 from 4-6 and 5/18 from 11-2. Beautiful home. Close to freeways, rec center, shopping, and schools. Owner has used the basement as an Airbnb bringing in roughly $1200/month.

PRICE REDUCED Super awesome private homestead ranch on 20+ acres in a gated community. One hour away from Ogden and Salt Lake City. 20 minutes from Evanston, Wyoming. 10 minutes to boating and lake recreation at Echo Reservoir. This property is located on the top of the mountain so you'll never see or hear a neighbor. It features a small cabin with a bedroom loft, kitchen, living room, 3/4 bathroom, and primary bedroom suite that is super cozy and move-in ready. The cabin was permitted and grandfathered into this community which makes it a super rare opportunity! The lot also features 2 other tiny homes you can share with guests or make into your perfect man-cave/ she-cave. Although this mountain doesn't offer utilities, the current owner has installed everything you need and more! Solar panels with batteries, 250-gallon water barrel completed with pump and tankless water heater, 250-gallon propane tank, and a working potty. There is also a 40 ft. shipping container for storage or build it out for an extra bunk house (will be included in the sale at the right price, negotiable ). Wildlife is abundant here and you won't miss out on seeing deer, elk, moose, grouse, and even a bear or cougar! Sit back in your chair and stare at the stars with only the sounds of nature. Best 360 views on the mountain. ATV, Snowmobile, and equestrian trails from your front door! Roads not maintained in winter, must have snow machines to access. Hunting is permitted on your own property. Must ask permission from neighbors to hunt on theirs. Don't miss this opportunity! Must call agent for showing. Lot Association Information and maps can be found at EchoCreekRanches.com

270 degree VIEWS! Remarkable Design and Execution of this Promontory Dream Estate! This elegant home spans 5, 015 square feet, set on a generous 2.6-acre flat lot at the high point of Private Estates; offering seclusion, as well as sweeping mountain & golf course views from its prime, elevated position overlooking the Nicklaus Painted Valley Golf Course. Featuring five sumptuous bedrooms & five beautifully appointed bathrooms, this home comes fully outfitted with high-end furnishings & decor. The interior has been carefully curated with custom wallpaper & exquisite stone finishes, creating an inviting & luxurious ambiance throughout. Huge swaths of glass provide immense natural light into the home, while showcasing views from literally every window in the house. The expansive deck is ideal for outdoor living & entertaining, complete with a Green Egg grill, fireplace, & stylish patio furniture. The lower-level patio includes an additional fireplace, comfortable seating area, & a fenced grassy backyard, perfect for small dogs. Not to be overlooked are the home theatre with dreamy overstuffed leather tiered seating, & the glass enclosed gym space complete with a rubberized flooring system. This home is literally in the heart of Promontory, with its prime location just a short walk to the Beach Club, less than 2 mins to the Nicklaus Compound featuring the Lavender Spa & the Peak Fine dining. Also, its less than 5 mins to the Equestrian gate, or to the Village amenity Compound. Additionally, a Social membership is available for separate purchase, providing access to Promontory's world-class amenities and the ability to play golf 8 rounds per season. Do not miss this opportunity to experience refined mountain living at 6730 Painted Valley Pass, where spectacular views, luxurious finishes, & a prime location come together to create an exceptional home.

Whether you're enjoying a quiet evening on the deck, entertaining friends in the spacious kitchen, or exploring the vast acreage, this property promises an unparalleled lifestyle. The property is surrounded by a pristine natural landscape, offering peace, privacy, and the opportunity to enjoy the great outdoors right at your doorstep. Close to great fishing, hunting, ATV trails, and hiking. Don't miss the chance to own this exquisite piece of paradise. Schedule a viewing today and experience the magic of this log home for yourself!

Welcome to a true architectural gem nestled in one of Utah's most beautiful mountain valleys. Designed in 1967 by the visionary Eugene Haycock, this Mid-Century masterpiece is a testament to innovative design and timeless beauty. Among the many features of this home is its striking silhouette. The roof, a hyperbolic parabola (look it up, you'll be amazed) seemingly floats above the structure. This engineering marvel allows for floor-to-ceiling glass walls, creating a seamless connection between the interior and the breathtaking natural surroundings. Step inside and you're greeted by an abundance of natural light and panoramic views of the mountains that surround you. The open floor plan effortlessly flows from one space to the next, with a custom open staircase serving as the centerpiece of the home. With four bedrooms and three baths, including a spacious primary suite, there's plenty of room for family and guests to unwind in comfort. Outside, the nearly 3/4 acre yard is a lush oasis, dotted with trees from the home's former apple orchard. Many of these trees still produce a rare heirloom variety; there's even an apple storage cooler in the oversized 3-car garage/shop. Rarely does a home of this caliber become available. Don't miss your chance to own a piece of architectural history close to all the natural beauty Utah is known for. Welcome to your Mid-Century masterpiece. This lovely bungalow has finally come back to market! With its low pitched roof and prominent front porch, the three bedroom, three bath home beautifully represents the Arts & Crafts architecture. The residence; however, is not just a renovated turn-of-the-century bungalow. This home was custom built in 2005 and was done so with thoughtful design and expert craftsmanship. Take for example the shake shingle exterior and genuine stone cladding chimney. Some Arts & Crafts bungalows can suffer from interiors being dark and closed off, but the interior here is open and bright with lots of windows and contemporary finishes such as bamboo flooring, quarter sawn oak cabinetry and Viking range. We love the butler station with that wallpaper treatment, and the fireplace in the living room feels so cozy! The primary bedroom is on the main floor, and it is spacious. The en suite bathroom boasts a separate bubble tub, shower with body sprays and double walk-in closets. On the lower level you'll find 2 more bedrooms, a family room as well as a 2nd fireplace. There's plenty of storage space, both here and in the detached 2 car garage at the back of the property. Location! Location! Location! No HOA! Completely off grid! Sale includes the recently proofed .75 acre foot water right #51-8943 which is 'Grandfathered' to be enough to drill a well since the subdivision was established before April 2004 (per conversation with Tim at Sanpete County Zoning on 25 Mar 2024). This could be your very own private bugout/strategic property which includes two attached Tough Sheds making a delightful 292 sq ft bunkhouse with a loft which sleeps up to 5, a wood stove, solar panels, two batteries, a small fridge, small high windows (to protect against break-ins) in every room, skylight, some insulation, a 5'x12' covered deck faces east to capture glorious sunrises and enjoy the mountain and valley views. Until you drill the well, a 55-gallon water barrel serves as the receptacle for drinking water. About 150 feet from the bunkhouse is a basic outhouse which uses two partially buried 55-gallon drums with the bottoms cut out to process waste like a septic system. For your comfort, a regular toilet 'seat' sits on top of the wooden platform which rests above the barrels. A 20' clothesline/dogrun runs from the bunkhouse to a tree with a cord (to attach to your dogs collar) to keep him/her close and not allow her/him to run off chasing after who-knows-what! Mostly Year-Round, you'll need four-wheel drive or possibly a vehicle with tracks during heavy snow fall. This incredible property comes with all the amenities Sanpete has to offer: grocery and hardware store, restaurants, drive-in movie theater, hospital, aquatics center, and miles of trails for your four-wheeler, side-by-side, snow shoes, hiking, or mountain bikes. This is a wonderful place to enjoy making memories (and S'mores) over the firepit, telling stories, hiking or riding, and looking at the stars! Come to Sanpete - you'll love it here! Arrange an appointment today to see this 'Hidden Gem'!

Hobble Creek Ranch is one of the most magnificent properties in the American West. It offers a truly unique propositiona stunning estate home with a backyard playground extending over 3, 387 acres (over 4.5 miles wide) of spectacular recreational lands. The property has substantial water rights along with seven ponds, and it controls access to over ten thousand acres of forest service lands. The home is securely positioned behind two gates and is surrounded by nearly twenty beautifully manicured acres. Every element of the home was built to the highest standards, and the finish work and detail are unrivaled. The location is really special. You feel like you are miles and miles away from anyone, yet there is a golf course ten minutes away and a grocery store only a short drive from there. Hobble Creek Ranch is situated at the end of a paved road in Hobble Creek Canyon, which is about an hour from Salt Lake City and Park City, and about thirty minutes from a private airport.

Riverfront gem in Mona. Rare opportunity to own a piece of heaven. This 30 acre parcel provides many options for it's use. Currant creek runs through the middle of the property. There is also an irrigation ditch that runs down from the south east corner of the property into Currant creek. Sub-irrigated pasture land. Excellent grazing for horses, sheep or cattle, family farm. It sustains 10 to 15 head from spring to fall with year round flowing water. Hiking, atv, motorcycle trails right up the road to the west & East to Mount Nebo. Mona Reservoir & the crystal clear Burraston ponds with rope swings is nearby. Many possible uses that include RV Park, industrial, commercial, residential etc. It is in a flood zone. There is very easy access to power on the north from the Goshen Canyon Road. This property is not far from the Utah/Nevada border South of Lucin and about 5 miles West of the Sun Tunnels. To arrive at the property you take Hwy 30 and turn South onto Pilot Mountain Road. About 7 miles you come on Coal Bank Springs Road and follow that for about 2.5 miles. The property is about .25 miles south of Coal Bank Springs Road. There is no road directly to the property but the topography of the area is gentle rolling hills so a 4wd vehicle should be able to drive right up to the property. Along Pilot Mountain Road you see several landmarks, including the Transcontinental Railroad Line, Lucin Pond, and the Sun Tunnels are about 5 miles East of the property. Vegetation on the property includes Sagebrush, Prairie Grass, Wildflowers and Cactus. In the area I have seen rabbits, squirrel, lizards, Elk, Antelope and Deer. The property has great views of the Mountains to the East and the Salt Flats to the south. There are some rock outcroppings on the property. Soil is mostly sandy. There are no visible structures close to the property. There was a farm just north of the Sun Tunnels. The Sun Tunnels is a large - scale art installation. It consists of 4 large concrete cylinders, arranged on the desert floor in a cross pattern, that align with the sunrise and sunset on the summer and winter solstices. In addition to the solar framing, each of the cylinders has smaller holes representing the Draco, Perseus, Columba, and Capricorn constellations. The four concrete tubes act as viewfinders framing precise images which bring the vast space of the desert back to human scale. This would be a great property for someone who wants to be close to the mountains for recreation or wants to live off grid. The nearest towns with partial services are Grouse Creek to the North, and Montello, Nevada to the West. Wendover, Nevada to the south is the nearest town with full services. The property is Zoned Multi-Use 160. Seller has no water rights. No Utilities are in the vicinity. GPS Coordinates: 41.30625 - 113.96056

Built in 1929, this classic Yalecrest Tudor exudes timeless character both inside and out. The home's original stately persona was preserved when it underwent a thorough renovation by Northstar Builders in 2020 with thoughtful interior design decisions by Megan Garrett. The exterior of the home showcases all of the traditional hallmarks of the era: a mixed-materials facade with beautiful stone and brickwork, ornamental half timbering, and delightful details such as an archway between the front and side yards. Take a moment to enjoy the details of the entryway before stepping into the open living space on the main floor. The living room, dining room, and impressive gourmet kitchen are seamlessly connected and filled with natural light from the updated windows. A functional mudroom and a stylish powder room were added during the renovation. Between the main and second levels is one of the home's most unique features the dance hall . This spacious room sits above the tandem garage and features a stunning Batchelder fireplace. Continue to the upper level where you'll find the primary suite (with ensuite and walk-in closet), two additional bedrooms, a full bathroom, and conveniently located laundry appliances. The lower level offers flexibility to suit your needs. There are three rooms which could be used as a combination of bedrooms, storage, fitness, or office spaces, as well as a full bathroom. Situated on the corner of 1700 East and Yale Avenuetwo of the neighborhood's most iconic streetsyou'll notice the lovely, mature landscaping which is surrounded by a distinctive scalloped fence. The package comes complete with an imagination-inspiring playhouse and a patio with plenty of room for an outdoor kitchen.

ARTFUL ESCAPE IN CASTLE VALLEY- Set amongst the spectacular spires and cliffs of Castle Valley outside Moab, this artful adobe is a wonder of light and space. Picture windows and skylights throughout this three-bedroom, one-bathroom house let in natural light illuminating wood trim, floors, beams, and cabinets. Kitchen and bath were just remodeled, and there are new floors, a washer/dryer, and good water. An elevated tower room with a round window framing the iconic Castleton Tower makes a world-class yoga room, painting studio, or reading nook. Each of the three bedrooms is a private little refuge, two with doors to private outside sitting areas. Two wood stoves keep it cozy in winter and a swamp cooler cools it in summer. Two large decks and an ample space behind the house, with a large fire pit, create gathering places with breathtaking views. The mature juniper, spruce, pion, and cottonwoods create shade and seclusion year-round on this 4.62-acre lot. House is move-in ready and can be buttoned up tight for vacation use, or lived in full time with internet and a garden and fruit trees waiting for your touch. Two sheds have plenty of storage, including a root cellar. A secluded hot tub can be fired up for star gazing while soaking. Castle Valley offers a truly peaceful respite near all Moab's world-famous attractions, biking and hiking trails, music, festivals, and restaurants. This property is like owning your own little piece of a National Park, with the comforts of home, plus full water rights. Don't miss the chance for this special little property to change your life.

The walkout lower level is equally impressive as the upper levels with additional guest quarters, a second kitchen, and a spacious living area. The basement is also home to luxury amenities including a theater with multiple screens, designated golf simulator space, a gym and a custom game room. Located on a quiet street with a perfectly manicured yard, this picturesque estate is well situated to offer charming outdoor spaces for lounging and dining alfresco, a pickleball court, two story playhouse, and a well-appointed pool and spa. With unparalleled access to several world-class ski resorts and great proximity to downtown, Park City and the Salt Lake International Airport, this 'once in a lifetime' property truly is the ideal place to call home.

HIGH DESERT RED ROCK CAVES. 54.61 acres of majestic high desert slick rock, juniper, and sage along Hatch Wash, the major drainage from the Abajo Mountains to the Colorado River. The property boasts La Sal Mountain views to the northeast and Abajo Mountain views to the southwest. From high on the slick rock ridge overlooking the property, you see the immensity of Hatch Wash and appreciate the property's historical significance as a watering hole frequented by the Dominguez-Escalante exploration group in the 18th century. If the raw land isn't enough, the slick rock ridge drops off to a level sagebrush basin featuring five man-made rock caves carved into the sandstone cliff wall. Three of the caves are promising living quarters. A secured cave houses the wells' pressure system and a bank of solar batteries. The smallest cave is used for storage. The property has two proven, certified wells and 3.5 acre-feet of water rights. There is an existing 1980 single-wide manufactured home, which can be used as temporary living quarters for as many years as it takes to build your dream home. Next to the home is a spacious root cellar measuring approximately 12' x 10' and 10 feet high. The manufactured home is fully wired for electrical service from solar panels and is connected to a septic system. The property is ready to go for an off-grid lifestyle with ample water for the any number of trees you might wish to plant, and a future garden of any size. Drive through the gate and prepare to be amazed.

This home offers those everyday moments that make you appreciate that you're actually living the life you've chosen. It's not all just about space and square footage, it's about living your life in a space that makes every moment magical. It's about sundrenched lounging on lazy Sunday afternoons, stargazing on clear summer nights, or snuggled under a blanket with a cup of cocoa watching the snow fall. It's sitting with the ones you love cherishing those special times together. This gorgeous home backs onto the Traverse Ridge Conservation Easement so those spectacular never-ending mountain, valley, and lake views are protected, and aren't ever going anywhere.Imagine passing hours on the open deck listening to the quiet of nature, shaded siestas under the covered space. Or you could be relaxing in the 6-8 person hot tub while spying on the abundant wildlife from your secluded, fully fenced backyard, or listening to gentle music playing on the outdoor sound system while you contemplate your amazing life. When it's time to entertain the spacious formal living and dining rooms are practically begging you to gather and celebrate, and the airy great room with those panoramic Timpanogos views flooding in, makes every meal feel like a special occasion. If it's been a long day, imagine a relaxing soak in the master suite's jetted bathtub that lets you drift away from all your cares. Step out onto the heated tile floors, wrap up in a fluffy towel and turn on the fireplace while you snuggle up with a good book or watch a movie before bed. Upstairs you'll discover three additional oversize bedrooms where everyone can spread out in theirown private space of light-filled corners perfect for study or cozy escapes. And for the ultimate lifestyle upgrade: that full-blown in-law suite. Two bedrooms, a bathroom, laundry, and a full gourmet kitchen, give room to whomever has the luck to participate in your new way of living. Think: extended family visits, guest havens, or maybe even extra income! And let's not forget, you're in the heart of SunCrest, with its top-notch HOA and those legendary summer events. Community concerts, poolside splashes, movies in the park, and the Eagle Crest Trail right outside your door .It's those everyday livingstyle choices that end up creating your life's true style. But the cherry on top is that you get all this luxury with a practical side too. This home has all of the worry-free energy saving features you could hope for in a home. The $50, 000 Solar Array covers almost all of the power bill which leaves you extra dollars for spending on all the other things on your wish list. In addition to everything above, both Furnace/AC units have recently been replaced with high-efficiency systems that offer even more savings. A tankless water heater is not only more efficient, but also makes it convenient when you have a full house because you'll never run out of hot water for your family or guests. Lights out? No worries! This house has been fully wired for the use of a generator so you'll never go without power. Also, to add to your worry-free lifestyle, almost all of the appliances have been recently replaced with higher efficiency units so no need for costly repairs or replacements in the coming years. More dollars you can spend elsewhere! Truly a home that makes your dreams come true!

Bathrooms in Progress: Bathroom spaces feature countertops and vanities ready for installation. Additional Structures: 30 x 40 Shop: A Quality Western Steel building on an extended concrete pad, complete with a plumbed bathroom, 1, 200-gallon water cistern, pump, water heater, and electricity. 14' x 20' Finished Cabin: A charming retreat with electricity, plumbing, a small kitchen, wall-mounted propane heater, and a loft for storage. Well House: An 8' x 8' structure with aluminum siding and roof housing a 500-gallon water storage tank. 5. Utilities and Infrastructure: Solar Power: Solar panel arrays with inverters in a dedicated solar system with batteries housed securely in a 20' green shipping container. Water Supply: A reliable and versatile water supply system enhances the functionality of this desirable property. This system ensures a consistent supply for your needs. Domestic Water Storage: Two substantial 1, 200-gallon cisterns contribute to the domestic water needs of the property. -Shop Storage: One cistern is securely stored within the shop. Bunker Buried Tank: The second cistern is strategically buried near the bunker, serving both the cabin and the main house. This underground tank adds a layer of efficiency and sustainability to the property, ensuring a reliable water supply for residential use. Power Generation: A 12, 000 KW diesel generator located in the powerhouse offering a reliable power supply. 6.Included: 38-foot flatbed trailer with three axles. Potential Uses: Ideal for those seeking an off-grid lifestyle or a unique retreat with the opportunity to finish and customize the living spaces according to personal preferences. Ferron City today is a rural community located in western Emery County situated in a natural grazing drift between the 11, 000-foot Wasatch Plateau to the west (locally known as Ferron Mountain) and the winter range on the San Rafael Swell to the east of this property, and to the west of this property is Millsite Golf Course. Next to this property is fire station. There is farming and stock raising have been Ferron's economic mainstays throughout its history, however, since the decade of the 1970's, with the construction of the Hunter Power Plant and the development of coal mining operations to fuel its massive steam-electric generating units, Ferron's economic growth has been closely tied to fluctuations in the coal/power industries, and tourism's. This lot would be a great time to capitalize on the growth of Ferron to build a gas station, hotel, tiny homes, the sky's the limits. This is your opportunity to own a unique property and a piece of Cache Valley's history! The old Lewiston State Bank, originally built in the 1920s, was last purchased in June '23. The original Architect, Fred Hodgson also designed the Ray B. West building at USU and the Smithfield Library, both of which are included on the National Historic Registry. The bank is not currently on the Historic Registry but potentially could be. Restoration funding may be available if the design is approved through the Registry office. The bank is currently zoned for commercial use. Lewiston City Planning and Zoning has expressed willingness to accommodate a zoning change to mixed-use, multi-family, or single-family residential. Buyers will need to obtain a building permit, which is contracted through Hyde Park. The building was unoccupied for several decades with a disconnected roof drain, which resulted in substantial water damage. New beams to reinforce the roof and upstairs have been installed. Complete replacement of roof sheathing and membrane in November 2023. Also, a new roof drain has been installed which is temporarily being run/drained through an East window. The upstairs subfloor has been completely replaced. Structural engineering and a building permit will be needed before rebuilding the main floor and stairs. Most of the exterior walls have footings inside the building, which may be an option to build the support for a new floor. The East portion of the main floor (Director's room and bathroom) has not yet been removed. This area likely will need to be removed and rebuilt along with the rest of the main floor. Will need new plumbing, electrical, HVAC, insulation, etc. Currently has 1.5 allotted parking spaces, but Lewiston City has expressed willingness to arrange a long-term lease for additional parking. No overnight street parking in the winter. Is connected to a water meter. Camera work was inconclusive if the sewer is connected to the old septic tank or the city sewer system. There is a sewer line and manhole on the East side of the building. The roof drain will need to be reconnected to the stormwater drain, which has an opening along the north sidewalk. There is likely a line running on the East side of the building, which the neighbor to the South is also connected to for his roof drain. The power supply is nearby. It will come from the South/East. We have met with RMP and it could be run overhead or buried. Original blueprints will be provided to buyers. USU special collections also has original duplicates of all of Fred Hodgson's work, including the bank. Scans are included in the listing photos. Also photos of a proposed floor plan for a single-family residence. Can provide initial code analysis, completed by a licensed architect Dec. 2023 for occupancy change to a single-family residence. New lumber sitting in the bank is included with the purchase. Approximately 16' walls in the main lobby. Showings will only be available on Tuesdays March 12th, 19th, 26th, and April 9th from 1:00-2:00 PM. Please schedule showings, contractors, ect. during that time frame. Will need to use the ladders provided to access the upper level and roof. Use ladders at your own risk Some areas are open to a drop and there is a potential risk of falling. Please submit offers on or before April 12th, 9:00 pm with an acceptance deadline of April 15th 9:00pm. Only offers with a minimum of $1, 500 non-refundable earnest money will be accepted. See agent remarks for contact information. It will take some time to get a building permit, but this property is one of a kind and could be amazing! All information is provided as a courtesy and should be verified by the buyer.

NOW OFFERED IN TWO SMALLER PORTIONS: CABIN HOLLOW PORTION (940 ACRES) FOR $3, 950, 000, AND SKYLINE RIDGE PORTION (2, 082 ACRES) for $5, 950, 000. The Skyline Ranch is situated on the top of the Wasatch Plateau mountain range in central Utah, surrounded by the 1.4 million acre Manti-LaSal National Forest, and accessed from the famed 'Skyline Drive'. As one of the largest private land holdings on this entire mountain range, this rare block of private land runs from 8, 000 feet to over 9, 500 feet in elevation. The landscapes of the Skyline Ranch are dominated by large healthy aspen stands, punctuated by dense pines on its northern exposures, and by large alpine meadows which sweep across its gentle plateau-like topography. The numerous lush canyon bottoms are full of springs and small creeks, and almost 2 full miles of Gooseberry Creek runs directly through the ranch. Gooseberry Creek offers excellent fly fishing for surprisingly large cutthroat and rainbow trout, which flourish in its cold and clear high-mountain waters. Fishing for larger trout can be found within walking distance of the ranch, in the well-stocked Gooseberry Reservoir located on National Forest land. The Skyline Ranch protects areas considered critical for elk calving, and the large resident elk herds that inhabit the ranch through late fall offer some of the best hunting opportunities for trophy elk in all of Central Utah. This area is also famous for its trophy mule deer hunting, largely due to the mountain range's jaw-dropping alpine aesthetics.

Build a legacy estate on your working cattle ranch! East Canyon Ranch is accessible year-round and features an incredible combination of rolling grassland, spectacular canyons and dramatic ridgelines. Located off East Canyon Road in Morgan County and not far from the popular ski areas of Snowbasin and Powder Mountain. The ranch offers complete privacy and solitude and is surrounded by a large neighboring ranch to the east in addition to the expansive 3, 600-acre East Canyon Wildlife Management Area at its southern border. East Canyon Ranch is host to grazing horses and cattle from springtime through late summer/fall. Valuable stock watering rights associated with the ranch are included with the sale of the property. An ideal equestrian property with available boarding and training facilities is adjacent to the ranch entry. The entirety of the property being offered for sale is under a conservation agreement with a local land conservancy. The agreement allows a new owner to build 2 residences with accompanying garages and outbuildings. The ranch hosts a variety of wildlife, including deer, elk, and turkey plus a variety of smaller mammals and raptors. Numerous springs, year-round streams, and small ponds are located throughout the property. The ranch is also part of a highly coveted Cooperative Wildlife Management Unit (CWMU). This private hunting unit provides guaranteed hunting tags to the property's owner. Endless opportunities exist to explore meadows, draws, canyons, and ridgelines on foot, bike, or horseback. A yurt complex at the highest elevation on the ranch offers dramatic 365-degree views of surrounding mountain ranges.

San Juan River Farm- Breathtaking irrigated hay fields surrounded by stunning red rock formations. A remarkable turn key farm operation that has been immaculately maintained and conserved for decades! Being one of the only irrigated farms for miles, those traveling from all directions into Bluff are absolutely stunned by the San Juan River Farm and the historic valley which it lies in! San Juan River Farm consist of 143 +/- deeded acres with roughly 125 +/- acres under wheel line irrigation, 14 +/ acres of sub-irrigated bottoms. The simple, immaculate improvements masterfully amplify the aesthetics of the farm. As a result of the approximate 695 acre feet of water rights out of the San Juan River, the fertile soils have historically produced up to 700 tons of alfalfa hay depending on the rotation of planting with an average of 4 cuttings annually! Furthermore, the farm includes all necessary equipment needed to continue the operation including but not limited to multiple tractors, a swather, and hay equipment such as mowers, rakes, balers, sprayers, cultivators, seeders, discs, blades, drills, and much more! Additionally, irrigation equipment such as wheel lines and pumps, along with various other tools and equipment are included. Last but not least, there is also a 40 acre state lease and a 16 acre BLM lease bordering the deeded ground that are part of the farm. The farm includes a beautiful single level ranch style home that boasts 2, 520 +/- square feet with a large open floor plan consisting of 3 bedrooms and 2 1/2 baths. As you enter the house from the front, you are greeted with a spacious living room connected with the dining room and kitchen. As you continue to meander through the house, you will also find a commodious sun room for relaxation. Speaking of relaxation, the house also features a 70 x 14 veranda porch that covers the entire front of the house with ample lounging and dining space for you to enjoy the beautiful views while having a nice breakfast, lunch, or dinner while listening to the birds sing. Aside from the residence, other improvements located on the farm include a 100 x 100 hay barn, a 100 x 50 shop building, a 70 house trailer, and a grain building. Located in the Four Corners region where Colorado, New Mexico, Utah and Arizona meet. The beautiful town of Bluff has some jaw dropping scenery on the banks of the San Juan River. This area is filled with ancient Indian archaeology. One can drive throughout the Four Corners region and visit the sites that bring the world to Bluff. Monument Valley, Bears Ears, Gooseneck State Park, Valley of the Gods, Natural Bridges, Mesa Verde, Arches, Canyonlands and Hovenweep are just a few of the National Parks. Monuments, Navajo Tribal Parks and State Parks attract visitors due to their serenity, beauty and natural wonder. With an elevation of 4300 ft. the mild temperatures make this a great place to spend every month of the year. There are hundreds of miles of jeep trails and hiking trails. Nearby Sand Island is another great place to visit the ancient petroglyphs or to start your river rafting adventure. Bluff, Utah was nominated as one of Budget Travel Magazine's coolest small towns. The San Juan River Farm offers a multitude of possibilities and adventures for everyone. Whether you are looking for some added production to your existing ranch operation or would like to run some cows and have a feedlot on a portion. Bird watchers and nature lovers will enjoy the non-motorized Bluff River Trail which winds through wild, undisturbed habitat along the San Juan where geese, ducks, turkeys, deer and even an occasional road runner call home. From the warm weather in all seasons to the farming and recreational aspects this is an incredible property!! The farm is located nearly 1 mile east of Bluff. Blanding is just shy of 30 minutes north of the property. Monticello is approximately 45 minutes north of the property. Moab is just under 2 hours north of the farm as well.

13, 796 deeded acre ranch located about 145 miles southeast of Salt Lake City near Price, Utah. Historic Bruin Point is our backdrop. Scenic points offer dramatic views and the ideal habitat for big game and upland birds. The ranch is operated as a Cooperative Wildlife Management Unit in with the Utah DWR. It is professionally managed for elk, mule deer, black bear, and mountain lion, providing hunters with private tags and extended seasons. Rocky Mountain Big Horn Sheep and Turkey can be hunted with resident Utah lifetime licenses if drawn. The Ranch can pasture 100+ cow calf pairs during the summer on productive pastures also attracting big game. Seller has implemented a wildlife habitat and grazing resource improvement program through the Natural Resources Conservation Service. The ranch is accessed with a paved county road connecting to Utah State Highway 6. There are four private-gated entrances to the ranch, with no public access. Interior roads and ATV trails allow good access throughout the property and to the canyon drainages. The closest town to the property is Sunnyside, Utah, a small community of 2, 000 residents with a gas station and grocery store. The town was originally developed as a company town by Kaiser Coal Corporation for its workers until its mines closed in 1991. Price, the county seat of Carbon County, with a population of approximately 9, 000 is located about 25 miles northwest of the ranch via Utah Highway 6. Price is known as the coal capital of Utah and offers a multitude of coffee shops, restaurants, and several mainstream hotels along with stores for ranching, hunting and fishing supplies. Carbon County's Regional Buck Davis Field (KPUC) is located about 15 minutes from the ranch and has three runways including an 8, 000+ ft. main runway, 24-hour Jet A Fuel and potential hanger availability. All information herein was obtained from seller and county records, is deemed reliable but is not guaranteed. Buyer is responsible to verify all.

The property sits north of Payson on 239 acres and is within the annexation boundary of Payson City. The property is currently being leased by a local to farm alfalfa and grass hay and grazing for cows. Improvements include multiple agricultural buildings with power and culinary water from a well. Water rights associated with the property include 320.736 acre-feet with underground well and 14 springs. The water right can be used to irrigate 74.5 acres and a stock watering right of 812 ELU (Equivalent Livestock Unit). There are 4 artesian wells on the property in various locations that run year round. These water sources could provide beautiful landscapes and waterways within a future development. The property is zoned agricultural and the future land use plan will allow for low-density residential. The large size would make an excellent master planned development with multiple zones and uses, including high-density residential, commercial and industrial.

This is a true 'Tuscany Style Master Piece' home with a Mt. Timpanogos backdrop. It is as organic as you could possibly get. There is a large international airport within an hour & a smaller airport perfect for private air just minutes away. The home's golf simulator is so state of the art, not only does it have almost every course and tee's up the ball for you, the floor actually slants to adjust for pitch of your lie. Going back to the testament of the greener side of this home: Even before the sellers started their custom build, they were extremely conscious of all the materials that would go into building this home. While interviewing contractors, if they didn't have a non-toxic, low, or no VOC type of application, they weren't even considered for any part of the selection. It was important to them because they don't want themselves, their children, or any of their five lovely grandchildren breathing the chemicals that harm their immune systems. All of the reclaimed wood that was used in (the temperature and climate controlled) wine room and barn doors were tested for heavy metals like lead. The outside farmland hay, alfalfa, and bluegrass, grown for the horses, cows, and chickens have never been sprayed with any type of herbicide. The wells and water are tested yearly to ensure the highest level of purity, no heavy metals, and no arsenic. The sellers have gone one step further and put a UV light in the ventilation of the house and on the well, no chemicals have ever touched this property. Not only is this one of the coolest homes in the state with all the toys, bells, and whistles but delivered with nicer touches and finishes you'll find elsewhere. As you look through the pictures of this home, take a moment and think of the painstaking time and effort to ensure the harmony between purity, function, entertaining, playfulness and happiness this home shares.

After a 20-year ownership by one Utah family, Chalk Creek Crossing is officially on the market. Summit County zone changes have reduced residential building envelopes in nearby areas from 40 to as little as 2.5 acres, creating the opportunity to develop spectacular residential projects close to the Park City Basin with its depleting residential opportunities. Summit County officials prefer this location for the residential and commercial projects that will eventually develop along Chalk Creek Road. New home owners will wake up to crisp mountain air, clear blue skies, and views of Coalville City, Chalk Creek, and the Weber River. The property is nestled between Coalville City to the south, Echo Reservoir to the west, and Echo Junction (I-80/I-84) to the north. Chalk Creek Crossing consists of approximately 125 acres, mostly agricultural with commercial potential. Both Coalville City and Summit County officials understand the potential of this property and are willing to discuss its future. Three reservoirs (Jordanelle, Rockport, and Echo), Park City, the Uinta Mountains, golfing, running, fishing, hunting, and several ski resorts are located nearby. Buyer can develop their own master plan for Chalk Creek Crossing incorporating a combination of single family lots, single family homes and condominiums, multi family housing, ranchettes, retail, office, and industrial buildings. Coalville City has been anticipating a large residential/commercial development at this location for several years. Industrial zoning is in place with an approved mix use overlay. A large residential/commercial project is being planned with Summit County south of Coalville in the Hoytsville area. Property consists of Summit County Tax ID #'s CT-301-C, CT-250, CT-301-C-1, CDRHTS-1 through 24. All information herein is deemed reliable but is not guaranteed. Buyer is responsible to verify all listing information, including square feet/acreage, to buyer's own satisfaction.

Seller financing GENERAL terms see Listing Broker for more details: 15% down, 5.5% simple interest, 1-year balloon. Payments are interest only. Seller must be in first position. No other fees, appraisal, loan original, etc. Deer Haven is a special area of large custom lots from 1 acres to 10 acres, located in The Ranches area of Eagle Mountain. Rarely do landowners, real estate developers, neighbors, special interest groups, and government officials collaborate together to create a community as special and unique as this one. Not only is this small yet distinctive community at the crossroads of a major deer migration corridor, it also provides refuge and feeding grounds for pronghorn and native bird populations (including quail, pheasant, and stunningly beautiful raptors), as well as many other smaller, furry, or flying friends! A conversation easement has been put in place to protect these animals and their habitats, affording you the uncommon opportunity to live peacefully among them; preserving their way of life while enjoying a front row seat to observe, commune, and bask in the beauties of nature. Bring your own builder. Other lots are available. Contact agent for more information. Owner/Broker.

A one of a kind home located in the wonderful community of Ephraim. Built in 1880 this home was considered the finest home in the valley. Constructed of oolite stone, the same stone used on historic building in Manti, the home boasts a Victorian look with 14 feet high ceilings, large and spacious rooms, refined wood work, three fireplaces, and a large yard. Reported to still be the only residential home in the valley with a third floor. You will appreciate the construction and detail of the home and the spectacular preservation of its earliest life. From original flooring to wall paper, the home reflects the elegance of early settlers to the area. Original and stunning chandelier and stove speak to the attention to detail applied to this wonderful home. Small upgrades have been made to accommodate new electrical and forced natural gas heating. A new asphalt shingle roof was completed in 2022 and a restoration of exterior wood, including paint, was completed in 2023. The yard boasts mature fruit trees, including apple, pear, and apricot, along with newly planted apple, cherry, peach and blackberry bushes. The backyard is completely fenced and can be accessed through the main entrance or via alleyway access. Two older out buildings speak to the history of the property and are in usable condition. Located in the heart of Sanpete Valley, Ephraim is home to Snow College which offers a wide variety of cultural and athletic activities. Ephraim is more than a town, it is a community full of welcoming residents and cultural diversity. The community is vibrant and growing. New buildings including a hospital are in the works, all walkable blocks from the property. The home has been a residence for its entire life, but its location and character lend itself to a potential commercial application, such as a bed and breakfast, art gallery, tea shop, or professional office. There are many possibilities with a home that is this rich in history and design. Original pioneer furnishings in the house can be negotiated as part of the sale. If you want to get away from the congestion and problems of the cities, you could come to this home in Manti, Utah with all the features that you could imagine in such a place. It has unobstructed views of meadows, hills and mountains, clean air, and a sense of quiet and peace. We have a large single level home with a spacious floor plan to support functional activities including entertainment, creative work, and personal solitude. A tour of the house in the order of the pictures begins with a view of the front with beautiful architecture, the stonework, and the porch. You enter the foyer with a formal dining room on the right and a private office or study with glass doors on the left. Moving into the large living room you see the fireplace with granite counters, a custom-designed mantel, and complementing shelves. The fireplace is thermostatically controlled to provide a cozy place to sit. The living room opens with French doors to the covered patio. The kitchen has many functional and convenience features with granite counters, a large island, and custom cabinets to the ceiling. It opens through an arch to a spacious breakfast area room with glass on two sides for a marvelous view of the fields and mountains. It also contains a set of custom-designed hardwood cabinets from floor to ceiling with 162 cubic feet of storage. The breakfast area opens to the covered patio and the back yard. Down the hall, we have a large TV room, which could also be a bedroom. A full bathroom is also off the hall. Then we have a large bedroom with its own bathroom. At the end of the hall is the crafts room with its own sink and cabinets, which could also be a bedroom. The large master bedroom is a home within a home with ample space for the king-size bed, large dressers and couch seating area. Off of the master bedroom is the sunroom with glass on three sides, which could be used as a study or lounging area. They planted gardens and orchards, raised horses and hunted predators, ranching and playing in some of the Southwest's most unbelievable expanses of Wilderness. Must see to appreciate this well maintained 3200 sq/ft pioneer home located in the historically charming town of Leeds, where it sits proudly at the SW corner of Main and Center Streets. From its humble beginnings in the summer of 1881, when Willard McMullin completed the one room rock house with 18 inch stone walls and 9' ceiling, this home continued to expand and remained within the McMullin family until 2006.In 2007, the home was lovingly refurbished by its present owner who was able to enlarge and upgrade the home with modern conveniences whilst maintaining the pioneer dignity the home is well known for. Included in the upgrades, were an added Primary Retreat, new metal roof, soffits, carpet, tile, energy efficient windows with levorlor shades, hickory cabinetry, and quartz kitchen counters, reverse osmosis as well as increasing the home's power panel to 200 amps from the standard 100. 2019 found the home receiving a new microwave, range, double ovens, air conditioner, furnace, and hot water recirculating system. There are both 30 and 50 amp outlets as well as a concrete pad for your RV needs. This home rests comfortably on .78 mostly fenced acres with mature Mulberry trees that lovingly provide much appreciated shade in the summer, Lady Banks Roses surround the side fences that explode with yellow blossoms to announce the end of Winter. Heirloom Roses that have seen their fair share of the happenings on Main Street in Leeds for decades. Two of the three bedrooms in this home have their own en-suites, giving the home a wide array of living arrangement possibilities. Storage? Did you want to know if it was possible for a pioneer home to have any storage? The short answer is, YES! First there is the large root cellar that still has the original coal chute (screened off to keep the locals out of course). The service porch has hickory storage cabinets the entire length, while the kitchen and pantry both have ample storage of their own, and did I mention the attached two car garage? This home is looking for its new forever family, and comes with its just completed septic system certification. Thank you for visiting.

What would it be like to live in SunCrest? Words fall short, but it's a full sensory experience: your lungs constantly fill with fresh air, your eyes take in towering peaks and twinkling valley lights, your feet touch and traverse miles of trails. Your senses seem heightened, dinner with friends on the patio tastes a little better, at night you seem to sleep a little deeper. If this seems a little lofty, then you've never been to Eagle Crest Drive, which is the pinnacle of the SunCrest Lifestyle. Perched atop a ridgeline, it's a street we hold in high regard. If you've ever explored the Eagle Crest Trailhead or SunCrest Park (both conveniently located nearby), chances are this house has caught your eye. Now is the time to answer that question about what it would be like to live in this home, as it's only hit the market once before and was swiftly snapped up by the current owners. Since then, they've cherished every minute of life here, and it's easy to see why. This home offers the best of SunCrest living-windows at every turn, wide-open spaces for entertaining, and easy access to the fresh SunCrest air. The main level caters to daily convenience, with a southeast-facing kitchen, perfect for enjoying breakfasts bathed in the glow of a Mt. Timpanogos sunrise. The family room and dining room flow seamlessly together, just as they should. Our favorite spot? The large, covered Trex deck. Where else can you find views like these? Upstairs boasts 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, including the primary bedroom with the home's best views. A standout feature of this home is its basement in a configuration that's a rarity in SunCrest. Offering close to 2400 square feet of finished living space, this full walkout basement, originally a model home, presents unparalleled versatility. Two bedrooms, another full bathroom, a spacious theater room, yet another gathering space (game room?) and flex space await, accommodating various lifestyle needs, from personal projects to potential income-generating endeavors. Outside, the professionally landscaped yard epitomizes SunCrest tranquility. It's flat, fenced, and full of mature trees, and serves up never-ending views that will soon fill your camera roll. Whether you are relaxing to the peaceful sound of your private waterfall or staring at the stars from the built-in gas firepit, from top to bottom, inside and out, this home presents a rare opportunity that doesn't come around often.

Wonderful home quietly tucked in at the end of a cul-de-sac in a family friendly neighborhood. Open House Saturday, May 18th from 12-2PM Picking favorites is a tricky business. Sometimes it's okay-favorite color, favorite movie, favorite dessert-but in other cases, like picking a favorite child (or at least saying it out loud) could land you in hot water. It gets even trickier to pick a favorite part of this terrific 2-story home in Eagle Mountain. Nestled on Folkstone Road, the location in this booming town might be your top reason to like it. The community comes with bragging rights; it's young and vibrant and has loads to offer with schools, shopping, recreation, and exciting growth. But once you see the home itself, you might think the low maintenance nature is the leading reason to love it. There's no weekend to-do list, as the home is nearly brand new, and only lightly lived in, and fully landscaped. We hear all the time that people want a house that's easy to maintain and with a layout that makes sense. Here you have that; the upstairs finds 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and the laundry room. Downstairs is your open canvas a second family room, game room, wet bar, extra bedroom or bathroom? The choice is yours. We couldn't pick our favorite part of this house any more than we can choose between inhaling or exhaling, but there are several contenders on the list to consider. First, updates. The gourmet kitchen, custom finishes, and updated fixtures throughout are stunning. Second, that main floor. Whether it's Sunday brunch, a casual party, or getting together with the gang from the good ol' days, the kitchen and family room open up to a concrete patio in the backyard (hello, less yard work!). Another possible fave? We're eyeing that covered pergola and hot tub area out back because nothing shouts summer more than the ability to spend evenings out in that fresh summer air. There's even a place for kids or four legged friends to play around on the grass. Sensible floor plan, popular location, and convenient lifestyle-which will be your fave?

The Bear Valley Ranch is an expansive ranch with blocks of private deeded lands running from its winter pastures located along the Sevier River near Richfield, up to 9, 800 foot alpine basins in the Monroe Mountain Range and surrounded by the Fishlake National Forest. Nestled in the serene countryside of Amalga, Utah, lies a modest dairy farm, offering a serene retreat for those seeking a simpler way of life. With over 3000 feet of river frontage, this charming property provides a peaceful backdrop for daily operations. The dairy facilities, though modest in scale, have been thoughtfully maintained and are fully equipped to support the needs of a small herd. Cozy barns provide shelter for the cows, while a functional milking parlor ensures efficient milk production. Additionally, the property features a comfortable home where the owners can rest and recharge after a day's work on the farm. A quaint shop provides space for equipment storage and maintenance, while three hay barns offer ample storage for feed and supplies. The property's lush pastures provide ample grazing space for the cows, ensuring they lead healthy and happy lives. Surrounded by the natural beauty of Utah's countryside, with views of the river and distant mountains, this dairy farm offers a tranquil setting for both work and relaxation. Whether you're a seasoned farmer looking to downsize or a newcomer seeking a fresh start, this property offers the perfect blend of functionality and charm. With its modest scale and peaceful ambiance, this dairy farm is more than just a piece of property-it's a place to call home. Embrace the opportunity to live a simpler, more fulfilling life in the heart of Amalga, Utah.
